list_definition.definition: a thin bubble on the skin, containing liquid

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My feet have blisters after walking so far.

list_definition.definition: a similar spot on any surface

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Blisters had begun to appear on the paintwork.

list_definition.definition: to (cause to) rise in a blister or blisters

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: . If there’s dampness behind the wall, the paint will eventually blister.

list_ex_of_english: Further, his skin is covered by blisters, an appropriate element for a painting likely originated as an ex voto for the end of plague.
If the person, through having ridden for some considerable time, had a temporary disability, with blisters on a part of his anatomy, he would not be "fit" to ride.
I found them with the shafts of their picks wrapped round with cotton waste and other rags in an endeavour to save their hands from blistering.
They were kept in the trucks in blistering heat without any water.
Petechial hemorrhages, blistering and severe scaling of the skin may develop.
The bark on young trees is thin, smooth, gray, and covered with resin blisters.
The prophecy about a blistering attack has not come true.
Animals with blisters on their tongues, their mouths and their feet suffer seriously.
